maml:description.maml:para: Add IpRules or VirtualNetworkRules to the NetworkRule property of a Storage account
The Add-AzureRmStorageAccountNetworkRule cmdlet adds IpRules or VirtualNetworkRules to the NetworkRule property of a Storage account

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group contains the Storage account.
Specifies the name of the Storage account.
Run cmdlet in the background
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The Array of IpAddressOrRange, add IpRules with the input IpAddressOrRange and default Action Allow to NetworkRule Property.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of the resource group contains the Storage account.
Specifies the name of the Storage account.
Run cmdlet in the background
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The Array of IpRule objects to add to the NetworkRule Property.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of the resource group contains the Storage account.
Specifies the name of the Storage account.
Run cmdlet in the background
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The Array of VirtualNetworkResourceId, will add VirtualNetworkRule with input VirtualNetworkResourceId and default Action Allow to NetworkRule Property.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of the resource group contains the Storage account.
Specifies the name of the Storage account.
Run cmdlet in the background
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The Array of VirtualNetworkRule objects to add to the NetworkRule Property.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Run cmdlet in the background
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The Array of IpAddressOrRange, add IpRules with the input IpAddressOrRange and default Action Allow to NetworkRule Property.
The Array of IpRule objects to add to the NetworkRule Property.
Specifies the name of the Storage account.
Specifies the name of the resource group contains the Storage account.
The Array of VirtualNetworkResourceId, will add VirtualNetworkRule with input VirtualNetworkResourceId and default Action Allow to NetworkRule Property.
The Array of VirtualNetworkRule objects to add to the NetworkRule Property.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Parameters: IPRule (ByValue)
Parameters: VirtualNetworkRule (ByValue)

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add several IpRules with IPAddressOrRange

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command add several IpRules with IPAddressOrRange.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Add a VirtualNetworkRule with VirtualNetworkResourceID
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$subnet = Get-AzureRmVirtualNetwork -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroup" -Name "myvirtualnetwork" | Get-AzureRmVirtualNetworkSubnetConfig PS C:\>Add-AzureRMStorageAccountNetworkRule -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroup" -Name "mystorageaccount" -VirtualNetworkResourceId $subnet[0].Id

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command add a VirtualNetworkRule with VirtualNetworkResourceID.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Add VirtualNetworkRules with VirtualNetworkRule Objects from another account
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $networkrule = Get-AzureRMStorageAccountNetworkRuleSet -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroup" -Name "mystorageaccount1" PS C:\> Add-AzureRMStorageAccountNetworkRule -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroup" -Name "mystorageaccount2" -VirtualNetworkRule $networkrule.VirtualNetworkRules

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command add VirtualNetworkRules with VirtualNetworkRule Objects from another account.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Add several IpRule with IpRule objects, input with JSON

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command add several IpRule with IpRule objects, input with JSON.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add legal hold tags to a Storage blob container with Storage account name and container name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds legal hold tags to a Storage blob container with Storage account name and container name.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Add legal hold tags to a Storage blob container with Storage account object and container name
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$accountObject = Get-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroup" -AccountName "myStorageAccount" PS C:\>Add-AzureRmStorageContainerLegalHold -StorageAccount $accountObject -ContainerName "myContainer" -Tag tag1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds legal hold tags to a Storage blob container with Storage account object and container name.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Add legal hold tags to all Storage blob containers in a Storage account with pipeline

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds legal hold tags to all Storage blob containers in a Storage account with pipeline.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get a specific access key for a Storage account
command:example.dev:code:
This command gets a specific key for a Storage account. This command works for Azure PowerShell version 1.4, and later versions. PS C:\>(Get-AzureRmStorageAccountKey -ResourceGroupName "RG01" -AccountName "mystorageaccount").Value[0]
This command gets a specific key for a Storage account. This command works for Azure PowerShell version 1.3.2, and previous versions. PS C:\>(Get-AzureRmStorageAccountKey -ResourceGroupName "RG01" -AccountName "mystorageaccount").Key1

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the Storage resource usage of the current subscription.
The Get-AzureRmStorageUsage cmdlet gets the resource usage for Azure Storage for the current subscription.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Indicate to get Storage resources usage on the specified location. If not specified, will get Storage resources usage on all locations under the subscription.

Indicate to get Storage resources usage on the specified location. If not specified, will get Storage resources usage on all locations under the subscription.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the Storage resources usage of the current subscription.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get the storage resources usage of specified location
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Get-AzureRmStorageUsage -Location 'West US'
LocalizedName : Storage Accounts Name : StorageAccounts Unit : Count CurrentValue : 18 Limit : 250

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the Storage resources usage of of specified location under the current subscription.

maml:description.maml:para: Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Management.Storage.Models.PSImmutabilityPolicy

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Lock ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container with Storage account name and container name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command Locks ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container with Storage account name and container name.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Lock ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container, with Storage account object
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$accountObject = Get-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroup" -AccountName "myStorageAccount" PS C:\>$policy = Get-AzureRmStorageContainerImmutabilityPolicy -StorageAccount $accountObject -ContainerName "myContainer" PS C:\>Lock-AzureRmStorageContainerImmutabilityPolicy -StorageAccount $accountObject -ContainerName "myContainer" -Etag $policy.Etag -Force

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command locks ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container, with Storage account object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Lock ImmutabilityPolicyof a Storage blob container, with container object
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$containerObject = Get-AzureRmStorageContainer -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroup" -AccountName "myStorageAccount" -Name "myContainer" PS C:\>$policy = Get-AzureRmStorageContainerImmutabilityPolicy -Container $containerObject PS C:\>Lock-AzureRmStorageContainerImmutabilityPolicy -Container $containerObject -Etag $policy.Etag -Force

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command locks ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container with Storage container object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Lock ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container, with ImmutabilityPolicy object

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command locks ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container, with ImmutabilityPolicy object.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a Storage account.
The New-AzureRmStorageAccount cmdlet creates an Azure Storage account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group in which to add the Storage account.
Specifies the name of the Storage account to create.
Specifies the SKU name of the Storage account that this cmdlet creates. The acceptable values for this parameter are: - Standard_LRS. Locally-redundant storage.
- Standard_ZRS. Zone-redundant storage.
- Standard_GRS. Geo-redundant storage.
- Standard_RAGRS. Read access geo-redundant storage.
- Premium_LRS. Premium locally-redundant storage.
Specifies the location of the Storage account to create.

Specifies the access tier of the Storage account that this cmdlet creates. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Hot and Cool. If you specify a value of BlobStorage for the Kind parameter, you must specify a value for the AccessTier parameter. If you specify a value of Storage for this Kind parameter, do not specify the AccessTier parameter.
Run cmdlet in the background
Generate and assign a new Storage account Identity for this Storage account for use with key management services like Azure KeyVault.
Specifies the name of the custom domain of the Storage account. The default value is Storage.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Indicates whether or not the Storage account only enables HTTPS traffic.

Specifies the kind of Storage account that this cmdlet creates. The acceptable values for this parameter are: - Storage. General purpose Storage account that supports storage of Blobs, Tables, Queues, Files and Disks.
- StorageV2. General Purpose Version 2 (GPv2) Storage account that supports Blobs, Tables, Queues, Files, and Disks, with advanced features like data tiering.
- BlobStorage. Blob Storage account which supports storage of Blobs only.
The default value is Storage.

NetworkRuleSet is used to define a set of configuration rules for firewalls and virtual networks, as well as to set values for network properties such as services allowed to bypass the rules and how to handle requests that don't match any of the defined rules.
Key-value pairs in the form of a hash table set as tags on the server. For example: @{key0="value0";key1=$null;key2="value2"}
Indicates whether to enable indirect CName validation.

Specifies the access tier of the Storage account that this cmdlet creates. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Hot and Cool. If you specify a value of BlobStorage for the Kind parameter, you must specify a value for the AccessTier parameter. If you specify a value of Storage for this Kind parameter, do not specify the AccessTier parameter.
Run cmdlet in the background
Generate and assign a new Storage account Identity for this Storage account for use with key management services like Azure KeyVault.
Specifies the name of the custom domain of the Storage account. The default value is Storage.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Indicates whether or not the Storage account only enables HTTPS traffic.

Specifies the kind of Storage account that this cmdlet creates. The acceptable values for this parameter are: - Storage. General purpose Storage account that supports storage of Blobs, Tables, Queues, Files and Disks.
- StorageV2. General Purpose Version 2 (GPv2) Storage account that supports Blobs, Tables, Queues, Files, and Disks, with advanced features like data tiering.
- BlobStorage. Blob Storage account which supports storage of Blobs only.
The default value is Storage.
Specifies the location of the Storage account to create.
Specifies the name of the Storage account to create.

NetworkRuleSet is used to define a set of configuration rules for firewalls and virtual networks, as well as to set values for network properties such as services allowed to bypass the rules and how to handle requests that don't match any of the defined rules.
Specifies the name of the resource group in which to add the Storage account.
Specifies the SKU name of the Storage account that this cmdlet creates. The acceptable values for this parameter are: - Standard_LRS. Locally-redundant storage.
- Standard_ZRS. Zone-redundant storage.
- Standard_GRS. Geo-redundant storage.
- Standard_RAGRS. Read access geo-redundant storage.
- Premium_LRS. Premium locally-redundant storage.
Key-value pairs in the form of a hash table set as tags on the server. For example: @{key0="value0";key1=$null;key2="value2"}
Indicates whether to enable indirect CName validation.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a Storage account
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroup -AccountName mystorageaccount -Location westus -SkuName Standard_GRS

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a Storage account for the resource group name MyResourceGroup.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Create a Blob Storage account with BlobStorage Kind and hot AccessTier
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroup -AccountName mystorageaccount -Location westus -SkuName Standard_GRS -Kind BlobStorage -AccessTier Hot

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a Blob Storage account that with BlobStorage Kind and hot AccessTier

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Create a Storage account with Kind StorageV2, and Generate and Assign an Identity for Azure KeyVault.
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>New-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroup -AccountName mystorageaccount -Location westus -SkuName Standard_GRS -Kind StorageV2 -AssignIdentity

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a Storage account with Kind StorageV2. It also generates and assigns an identity that can be used to manage account keys through Azure KeyVault.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Create a Storage account with NetworkRuleSet from JSON

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a Storage account that has NetworkRuleSet property from JSON

- key2

Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Storage account.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container with Storage account name and container name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container with Storage account name and container name.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container, with Storage account object
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$accountObject = Get-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroup" -AccountName "myStorageAccount" PS C:\>$policy = Get-AzureRmStorageContainerImmutabilityPolicy -StorageAccount $accountObject -ContainerName "myContainer" PS C:\>Remove-AzureRmStorageContainerImmutabilityPolicy -StorageAccount $accountObject -ContainerName "myContainer" -Etag $policy.Etag

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container, with Storage account object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Remove ImmutabilityPolicyof a Storage blob container, with container object
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$containerObject = Get-AzureRmStorageContainer -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroup" -AccountName "myStorageAccount" -Name "myContainer" PS C:\>$policy = Get-AzureRmStorageContainerImmutabilityPolicy -Container $containerObject PS C:\>Remove-AzureRmStorageContainerImmutabilityPolicy -Container $containerObject -Etag $policy.Etag

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container with Storage container object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Remove ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container, with ImmutabilityPolicy object

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container, with ImmutabilityPolicy object.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the current Storage account of the specified subscription.

The Set-AzureRmCurrentStorageAccount cmdlet modifies the current Azure Storage account of the specified Azure subscription in Azure PowerShell. The current Storage account is used as the default when you access Storage without specifying a Storage account name.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies an AzureStorageContext object for the current Storage account. To obtain a storage context object, use the New-AzureStorageContext cmdlet.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies the name of the Storage account that this cmdlet modifies.
Specifies the resource group that contains the Storage account to modify.
Specifies an AzureStorageContext object for the current Storage account. To obtain a storage context object, use the New-AzureStorageContext cmdlet.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies the name of the Storage account that this cmdlet modifies.
Specifies the resource group that contains the Storage account to modify.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the current Storage account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the default Storage account for the specified subscription.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies a Storage account.
The Set-AzureRmStorageAccount cmdlet modifies an Azure Storage account. You can use this cmdlet to modify the account type, update a customer domain, or set tags on a Storage account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group in which to modify the Storage account.
Specifies the name of the Storage account to modify.

Specifies the access tier of the Storage account that this cmdlet modifies. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Hot and Cool. If you change the access tier, it may result in additional charges. For more information, see Azure Blob Storage: Hot and cool storage tiers (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=786482). If the Storage account has Kind as StorageV2 or BlobStorage, you can specify the AccessTier parameter. If the Storage account has Kind as Storage, do not specify the AccessTier parameter.
Run cmdlet in the background
Generate and assign a new Storage account Identity for this Storage account for use with key management services like Azure KeyVault.
Specifies the name of the custom domain.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Indicates whether or not the Storage account only enables HTTPS traffic.
Forces the change to be written to the Storage account.
If using -KeyvaultEncryption to enable encryption with Key Vault, specify the Keyname property with this option.

Indicates whether or not to use Microsoft KeyVault for the encryption keys when using Storage Service Encryption. If KeyName, KeyVersion, and KeyVaultUri are all set, KeySource will be set to Microsoft.Keyvault whether this parameter is set or not.
When using Key Vault Encryption by specifying the -KeyvaultEncryption parameter, use this option to specify the URI to the Key Vault.
When using Key Vault Encryption by specifying the -KeyvaultEncryption parameter, use this option to specify the URI to the Key Version.

NetworkRuleSet is used to define a set of configuration rules for firewalls and virtual networks, as well as to set values for network properties such as services allowed to bypass the rules and how to handle requests that don't match any of the defined rules.
Specifies the SKU name of the Storage account. The acceptable values for this parameter are: - Standard_LRS - Locally-redundant storage.
- Standard_ZRS - Zone-redundant storage.
- Standard_GRS - Geo-redundant storage.
- Standard_RAGRS - Read access geo-redundant storage.
- Premium_LRS - Premium locally-redundant storage.
You cannot change Standard_ZRS and Premium_LRS types to other account types. You cannot change other account types to Standard_ZRS or Premium_LRS.
Key-value pairs in the form of a hash table set as tags on the server. For example: @{key0="value0";key1=$null;key2="value2"}
Upgrade Storage account Kind from Storage or BlobStorage to StorageV2.
Indicates whether to enable indirect CName validation.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of the resource group in which to modify the Storage account.
Specifies the name of the Storage account to modify.

Specifies the access tier of the Storage account that this cmdlet modifies. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Hot and Cool. If you change the access tier, it may result in additional charges. For more information, see Azure Blob Storage: Hot and cool storage tiers (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=786482). If the Storage account has Kind as StorageV2 or BlobStorage, you can specify the AccessTier parameter. If the Storage account has Kind as Storage, do not specify the AccessTier parameter.
Run cmdlet in the background
Generate and assign a new Storage account Identity for this Storage account for use with key management services like Azure KeyVault.
Specifies the name of the custom domain.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Indicates whether or not the Storage account only enables HTTPS traffic.
Forces the change to be written to the Storage account.

NetworkRuleSet is used to define a set of configuration rules for firewalls and virtual networks, as well as to set values for network properties such as services allowed to bypass the rules and how to handle requests that don't match any of the defined rules.
Specifies the SKU name of the Storage account. The acceptable values for this parameter are: - Standard_LRS - Locally-redundant storage.
- Standard_ZRS - Zone-redundant storage.
- Standard_GRS - Geo-redundant storage.
- Standard_RAGRS - Read access geo-redundant storage.
- Premium_LRS - Premium locally-redundant storage.
You cannot change Standard_ZRS and Premium_LRS types to other account types. You cannot change other account types to Standard_ZRS or Premium_LRS.
Indicates whether or not to set the Storage account encryption to use Microsoft-managed keys.
Key-value pairs in the form of a hash table set as tags on the server. For example: @{key0="value0";key1=$null;key2="value2"}
Upgrade Storage account Kind from Storage or BlobStorage to StorageV2.
Indicates whether to enable indirect CName validation.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Specifies the access tier of the Storage account that this cmdlet modifies. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Hot and Cool. If you change the access tier, it may result in additional charges. For more information, see Azure Blob Storage: Hot and cool storage tiers (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=786482). If the Storage account has Kind as StorageV2 or BlobStorage, you can specify the AccessTier parameter. If the Storage account has Kind as Storage, do not specify the AccessTier parameter.

When using Key Vault Encryption by specifying the -KeyvaultEncryption parameter, use this option to specify the URI to the Key Vault.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the Storage account type

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the Storage account type to Standard_RAGRS.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Set a custom domain for a Storage account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets a custom domain for a Storage account.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Set the access tier value

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command sets the Access Tier value to be cool.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Set the custom domain and tags

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command sets the custom domain and tags for a Storage account.

command:example.maml:title: Example 5: Set Encryption KeySource to Keyvault
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Set-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "MyResourceGroup" -AccountName "mystorageaccount" -AssignIdentity PS C:\>$account = Get-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "MyResourceGroup" -AccountName "mystorageaccount"
PS C:\>$keyVault = New-AzureRmKeyVault -VaultName "MyKeyVault" -ResourceGroupName "MyResourceGroup" -Location "EastUS2" PS C:\>$key = Add-AzureKeyVaultKey -VaultName "MyKeyVault" -Name "MyKey" -Destination 'Software' PS C:\>Set-AzureRmKeyVaultAccessPolicy -VaultName "MyKeyVault" -ObjectId $account.Identity.PrincipalId -PermissionsToKeys wrapkey,unwrapkey,get
PS C:\>Set-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "MyResourceGroup" -AccountName "mystorageaccount" -KeyvaultEncryption -KeyName $key.Name -KeyVersion $key.Version -KeyVaultUri $keyVault.VaultUri

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command set Encryption KeySource with a new created Keyvault.

command:example.maml:title: Example 6: Set Encryption KeySource to "Microsoft.Storage"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command set Encryption KeySource to "Microsoft.Storage"

command:example.maml:title: Example 7: Set NetworkRuleSet property of a Storage account with JSON

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets NetworkRuleSet property of a Storage account with JSON

command:example.maml:title: Example 8: Get NetworkRuleSet property from a Storage account, and set it to another Storage account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This first command gets NetworkRuleSet property from a Storage account, and the second command sets it to another Storage account

command:example.maml:title: Example 9: Upgrade a Storage account with Kind "Storage" or "BlobStorage" to "StorageV2" kind Storage account

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command upgrade a Storage account with Kind "Storage" or "BlobStorage" to "StorageV2" kind Storage account.

maml:description.maml:para: Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Management.Storage.Models.PSImmutabilityPolicy

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create or update ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container with Storage account name and container name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates or updates ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container with Storage account name and container name.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Extend ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container, with Storage account object
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$accountObject = Get-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroup" -AccountName "myStorageAccount" PS C:\>$policy = Get-AzureRmStorageContainerImmutabilityPolicy -StorageAccount $accountObject -ContainerName "myContainer" PS C:\>Set-AzureRmStorageContainerImmutabilityPolicy -StorageAccount $accountObject -ContainerName "myContainer" -ImmutabilityPeriod 20 -Etag $policy.Etag -ExtendPolicy

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command extend ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container, with Storage account object. Extend ImmutabilityPolicy can only run after ImmutabilityPolicy is locked.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Update ImmutabilityPolicyof a Storage blob container
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$containerObject = Get-AzureRmStorageContainer -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroup" -AccountName "myStorageAccount" -Name "myContainer" PS C:\>$policy = Set-AzureRmStorageContainerImmutabilityPolicy -Container $containerObject -ImmutabilityPeriod 12 PS C:\>$policy = Set-AzureRmStorageContainerImmutabilityPolicy -Container $containerObject -ImmutabilityPeriod 9 -Etag $policy.Etag

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container with Storage container object 2 times, first to ImmutabilityPeriod 12 days without etag, then to ImmutabilityPeriod 9 days with etag.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Extend ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container, with ImmutabilityPolicy object

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command extend ImmutabilityPolicy of a Storage blob container, with ImmutabilityPolicy object. Extend ImmutabilityPolicy can only run after ImmutabilityPolicy is locked.
